description: Single storey rear extension to the Islamic Culture & Education Community Centre at 82-84 Horsenden Lane North
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the construction of the extension shall match the design and appearance of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the extension is compatible with the character and appearance of the existing property, in order to safeguard the character and appearance of the street scene, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Provision for refuse and recycling storage, shall be provided in accordance with the details shown on the approved plan PLAN/GW1A/04, prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall be retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of existing and future occupiers of the area and to safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance note 4: 'Refuse Storage'. | The car parking spaces and vehicle manoeuvring areas detailed on the application drawing PLAN/GW1A/04 hereby approved shall be laid out in accordance with the approved drawing and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the extension hereby approved, and retained as such thereafter.   Reason:  In the interests of highway safety and neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | The cycle parking provision detailed on the application drawings PLAN/GW1A/04 hereby approved shall be made available prior to commencement of the use hereby approved, and retained as such thereafter.    Reason:  In the interests of sustainable transport and cyclists in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | Prior to commencement of development, details of noise insulation and sound attenuation arising from the proposed extension hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved works shall be completed prior to the first use of the premises hereby permitted and the installed insulation and attenuation measures shall thereafter be retained.   Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of the occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site in accordance with polices 4.1 and 4.11 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | In conjunction with the hours of use of the main community facility that were imposed on planning permission P/2009/2188, the extension hereby approved shall not be used outside of the hours of 06:00 to 23:00, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with polices 4.1 and 4.11 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | In conjunction with conditon 5 of the planning approval P/2009/2188, no amplified voice, music or other sound shall be permitted within the extension hereby approved.  Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with polices 4.1 and 4.11 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | The proposed kitchen shall only function as a low-key ancillary facility for the preparation of light snacks and refreshments in connection with the main community use. No external extractor ducting or commercial industrial cooking equipment shall be installed in conjunction with its use, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of the occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site in accordance with polices 4.1 and 4.11 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | In conjunction with planning approval P/2009/2188 the premises shall be used as a place of worship and for no other purpose including any other use within Class D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:  To accord with the terms of the application and to maintain control over the impact of the use, in accordance with policies 4.1, 8.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | In accordance with the original approval P/2009/2188 no more than a maximum of 80 persons shall be on site at any one time, with a 'sign-in sign-out' register of persons attending the site maintained and available for inspection by the Local Planning Authority.    REASON:  To limit the impact of the development in respect on traffic generation, noise generation and parking stress in the interests of the amenities of nearby occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11, 8.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | This permission confers no extension to the original approval P/2009/2188, granted for a limited period expiring on 10 March 2013 when the main community use shall be discontinued, unless a further extension of permission is granted by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:  To allow the impacts of the development in respect on traffic generation, noise generation and parking stress to be monitored in the interests of the amenities of nearby occupiers, in accordance with policies 7.7, 8.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
